page.title: 12CONSERVATION IN STOURBRIDGE
page.content: There are 4 basic{conservation} areas in Stourbridge.In the whole area there are about 35 listed buildings and{Preservation}Orders on many trees.There is also a{green belt} traversing 2 sides of the area. The Conservation Area based on Love Lane,Oldswinford has many Victorian and Edwardian houses and cottages,e.g. Elmfield School. The area centred on St.Mary's Parish Church,Oldswinford includes many buildings in Church and Rectory Roads,particularly the Castle and the Church. The area within the ring road is conserved as are the buildings in Lower High Street and Market Street.The clock tower and the Town Hall are most notable.In the canal area a bonded warehouse forms part of the preserved{landscape.}
